articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is set to meet with U.S. President Donald Trump and sign a critical minerals deal on Friday as Kyiv works to regain U.S. support to fight off the Russian invasion as Washington reverses its punitive policy towards Moscow.
articles.title: Trump, Zelenskiy to sign minerals deal at White House meeting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The outlawed Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) militia declared an immediate ceasefire on Saturday, a news agency affiliated with the group said, heeding jailed leader Abdullah Ocalan's call for disarmament, in a major step toward ending a 40-year insurgency against the Turkish state.
articles.title: Kurdish PKK militia declares ceasefire, heeding jailed leader's call

articles.author: Dan Peleschuk, Yurii Kovalenko
articles.description: Ukrainians faced a stark new reality on Saturday, after a White House clash between President Volodymyr Zelenskiy and U.S. President Donald Trump plunged ties beween Kyiv and its top military backer into an unprecedented new low.
articles.title: Ukrainians reel from crisis in US ties after Trump-Zelenskiy clash

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: The meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy was becoming contentious on Friday when Vice President JD Vance, sitting on a couch across from Trump in the Oval Office, weighed in with a zinger.
articles.title: In Europe and in the Oval Office, VP Vance takes on attack dog role for Trump

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: An angry White House clash between Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy and Donald Trump divided the U.S. president's fellow Republicans and dimmed prospects that Congress will approve any further aid for Kyiv in its war with Russia.
articles.title: Trump-Zelenskiy clash divides US Republicans, dims aid prospects

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pope Francis was admitted to Rome's Gemelli hospital on February 14 with a severe respiratory infection that degenerated into double pneumonia.
articles.title: Pope Francis, after setback, had a peaceful night, Vatican says

articles.author: Ivana Sekularac
articles.description: Thousands stood in silence for 15 minutes in the southern city of Nis on Saturday to commemorate those killed in a railway station disaster, in a student-led protest that has grown into the biggest threat yet to the Serbian president's grip on power.
articles.title: Serbians hold silent protest to honour railway station victims

articles.author: Andrew Gray
articles.description: Hungary's prime minister has urged the European Union to start direct discussions with Russia on a ceasefire in Ukraine and drop plans for a joint declaration at an extraordinary EU summit next week, saying differences in the bloc "cannot be bridged".
articles.title: Hungary's Orban pushes direct Russia talks, opposes EU summit declaration

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkey's foreign minister will reiterate Ankara's offer to host peace talks between Ukraine and Russia at a meeting of European leaders in London on Sunday, a Turkish diplomatic source said on Saturday.
articles.title: Turkey to repeat offer to host Ukraine-Russia peace talks at London summit, source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Guyanese President Irfaan Ali said on Saturday that a Venezuelan coast guard patrol entered Guyanese waters earlier in the day, approaching an output vessel in an offshore oil block.
articles.title: Guyana says Venezuelan vessel entered oil block in Guyanese waters
